CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . NORP On unspecified dates immediately after World War II several plots of land were expropriated from the seventh and twelfth applicants , apparently in the absence of any decision to that effect .

CARDINAL . On various dates in DATE several plots of land were expropriated from the second , third , fourth , fifth , sixth , eighth , ninth , tenth and eleventh applicants by the relevant ORG decisions ( PERSON poljoprivredna komisija ) . These decisions would appear to have been upheld by ORG ( PERSON agrarni sud ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants filed a request with the Government seeking restitution of the expropriated plots of land , relying on LAW ( see paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants urged the Government to decide on their request .

CARDINAL . On DATE , not having received any response from the Government , the applicants initiated an administrative dispute ( upravni spor ) before ORG ( PERSON ) for “ silence of administration ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , which , in the meantime , had taken over the competencies of ORG in respect of administrative disputes ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , ruled against the applicants on the grounds that the Government had no jurisdiction to rule on their request .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG decision was dispatched by regular post to the ORG representative in the domestic proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the postman noted down that the applicants’ representative had moved from the address provided ( preseljen sa date adrese ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG noted that its judgment of CARDINAL DATE could not be served on the ORG representative as he had changed his address , failing to inform the court of the new one . Pursuant to LAW , the court decided that all the relevant documents ( sva pismena u ovom sporu ) would be served on the applicants by posting the documents on the court ’s notice board . Accordingly , the decision was posted on the notice board DATE and removed from it on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared a number of the core provisions of LAW unconstitutional including those relating to restitution in kind as well as the composition and the competencies of ORG ( see paragraphs DATE below ) .

CARDINAL . The Just Restitution Act DATE was never applied in practice . The Government have never enacted secondary legislation needed for its implementation and nor has ORG , which was supposed to deal with restitution requests , or any other relevant body , ever been established .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG entered into force , providing that the restitution of property to religious communities would be regulated by a separate law ( see paragraphs CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provided that restitution in kind should always be the rule and other forms of compensation , specified in section CARDINAL , “ only the exception ” , where restitution was not possible due to legal or factual reasons .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § § CARDINAL and CARDINAL provided that previous owners whose property rights had been taken away on the basis of , inter alia , a court judgment or a decision were also entitled to restitution .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) provided that de facto expropriations of property would be treated in the same manner as expropriations carried out on legal grounds .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL provided that religious organisations or communities ( vjerska organizacija ili zajednica ) could be beneficiaries of the right to restitution in the same manner as natural persons .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL provided that if the property had been taken on the basis of Republic regulations or by a Republic body action ( radnjom ) , the debtor ( obveznik restitucije ) was GPE . LAW § CARDINAL provided that if the property subject to restitution was owned by a natural or legal person , the debtor was that person .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provided that when the right to restitution could not be in kind , it could be exercised , inter alia , by providing other property of the same value or by compensation .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL provided that the Government of GPE would establish a ORG within DATE as of the date of entry into force of the Act .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL provided that restitution requests would be dealt with by ORG .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL prohibited the disposal of the property subject to restitution pursuant to the LAW ( zabranjen je promet ) until the relevant restitution proceedings had been concluded .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL provided that the Government would enact a decree on regulations and the implementation of the LAW within DATE of the date of entry into force of the Act .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL further provided that these regulations would further define the modalities of the LAW , including the establishing and functioning of ORG and ORG .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provided that CARDINAL of the members of the restitution commissions would be representatives of former owners .
CARDINAL . The Act entered into force on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG established that a number of provisions of LAW were unconstitutional and that they should cease to have effect as of the date of publication of its decision .

CARDINAL . ORG held , inter alia , that restitution in kind would be in breach of existing property rights . Other unconstitutional provisions referred mostly to the composition and competencies of ORG , and the limitations imposed by the LAW on current owners of property subject to restitution . In particular , it was held that : ( a ) ORG competence to decide on the restitution of property taken by virtue of final court judgments was contrary to the principle of separation of powers ; ( b ) the prohibition imposed on current owners to dispose of their property which was subject to restitution proceedings until the relevant proceedings had been concluded , was contrary to the current ORG property rights ; and ( c ) the provision that previous owners could be members of ORG was unacceptable because of their interest in the outcome of the proceedings .
CARDINAL . The decision was published on DATE .

CARDINAL . Sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL § CARDINAL provide that natural persons , endowments and other non - profitable legal persons ( zadužbine i druga nekomercijalna pravna lica ) are entitled to restitution or compensation in accordance with this LAW .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that the conditions , method and the procedure for the restitution of property to religious communities will be regulated by a separate law .
CARDINAL . The Act entered into force on DATE thereby repealing LAW .

CARDINAL . Sections DATE and CARDINAL provided that an ORG would be set up for the territory of GPE , and that its competencies would include , inter alia , deciding in administrative disputes on the lawfulness of administrative decisions ( o zakonitosti upravnih akata ) and other individual decisions .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provided that ORG would become operational by DATE .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL enables a party whose request has not been decided within the periods established in the previous paragraph to lodge an appeal with the appellate body as if his request had been refused . If the appeal is not allowed , the appellant can directly initiate an administrative dispute before the court with jurisdiction .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that court documents ( pismena ) shall be delivered via the regular post , but may also be delivered by a designated court employee , an authorised legal person registered for delivery , directly in court or in another manner as provided for by this Act .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that when a party has a representative ( punomoćnika ) , all court documents will be served on the representative .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that the delivery can be effected any day TIME at the flat or at the business premises of the person on whom a document is to be served . If the delivery can not be effected at the address and at the time provided for in paragraph CARDINAL of this section it can be effected at any time and at any place .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides that if a registered person ( subjektu upisanom u registar ) can not be served at the registered address , the documents will be posted on the court ’s notice board . DATE thereafter the delivery shall be deemed to have been fully effected .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that if during the proceedings a party or his / her representative changes the address to which the documents should be delivered they are obliged to immediately inform the court thereof . If they fail to do so , the court will order that the documents be posted on the court ’s notice board . The delivery shall be deemed to have been effected DATE after the document has been posted on the notice board .
